items.q: The Taiping Rebellion was a massive civil war in which country?
items.explanation: Lasting from 1850 to 1864, it was one of the deadliest conflicts in history, fought against the Qing dynasty.

items.q: The Meiji Restoration returned actual political power to and modernized the military of Japan in the mid-19th century.
items.explanation: It moved Japan from an isolated feudal society to modern industrialized nation.

items.q: The War of the Roses was fought between England and France.
items.explanation: It was a series of English civil wars for control of the throne involving the Houses of Lancaster and York.

items.q: What global pandemic killed an estimated 50 million people worldwide between 1918 and 1920?
items.explanation: Despite the name, it did not originate in Spain.

items.q: What agreement signed in 1648 is considered by scholars to mark the beginning of the modern system of sovereign states?
items.explanation: It ended the Thirty Years' War and the Eighty Years' War.

items.q: Who was the Ethiopian Emperor whose appeal to the League of Nations for help against Italian invasion in 1936 was famously ignored?
items.explanation: His speech warned that if action wasn't taken, other nations would fall next.

items.q: What ancient empire, centered in modern-day Iran, was eventually conquered by Alexander the Great?
items.explanation: It was founded by Cyrus the Great.

items.q: What economic philosophy regarding trade, prominent from the 16th to 18th century, emphasized maximizing exports and accumulating bullion?
Who was the female Prime Minister of India who was assassinated by her bodyguards in 1984?
items.explanation: She led India during crucial moments, including the creation of Bangladesh.

items.q: What uprising by a secret society in China sought to drive out all foreigners and foreign influence in 1900?
items.explanation: It was suppressed by an Eight-Nation Alliance of foreign powers.
